revised_title: The Influence of Concentration on the Spectra of Luminous Gases
tldr: The author investigates the effect of concentration on the spectra of luminous gases, specifically focusing on the broadening of lines in the spectra of sodium and lithium. Experiments reveal that the addition of large quantities of one element to a source containing another element does not cause the broadening of lines, suggesting that temporary associations of atoms are not the explanation for these phenomena.
